item.title: 朝日警告称啤酒厂因攻击瘫痪数据丢失
item.description: 朝日集团控股有限公司（Asahi Group Holdings Ltd.）首次披露了网络攻击者使用勒索软件导致其国内工厂停工并可能窃取数据的情况，这进一步揭示了一起网络漏洞事件，该事件引发了人们对该国安全防范措施的质疑。【原文：Asahi Group Holdings Ltd. revealed for the first time that cyber-attackers used ransomware to bring its domestic factories to a standstill and potentially stole data, shedding more light on an online breach that’s raised questions about the country’s security preparedness.】

item.title: 日本最大反对党不排除与自民党合作的可能性
item.description: 日本最大的反对党将推动在即将到来的额外预算中纳入应税的 20,000 日元（135 美元）现金派发，该党领导人表示，这是对是否可能与执政联盟加深合作的关键考验。【原文：Japan’s largest opposition party will push for taxable ¥20,000 ($135) cash handouts to be included in the upcoming extra budget, the party leader said, framing it as a key test of whether deeper cooperation with the ruling coalition is possible.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德呼吁非银行机构接受更严格审查
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）警告说，不要降低银行监管标准，而是必须加强对非银行的审查。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned against lowering standards in banking regulation, arguing that scrutiny of non-banks must be strengthened instead.】

item.title: 据报道欧盟拟转让 Strabag，Raiffeisen 股票大涨
item.description: Raiffeisen Bank International AG 的股价创下两个月来最大涨幅，原因是有报道称这家奥地利贷款机构可能获得 Strabag SE 的股份，作为其在俄罗斯被迫支付的损失赔偿。【原文：Shares of Raiffeisen Bank International AG rallied the most in two months on a report the Austrian lender may receive shares in Strabag SE as compensation for damages it was forced to pay in Russia.】

item.title: 艾米风暴袭击英国，英国电力跌至零度以下
item.description: 由于艾米风暴将在整个周末带来创纪录的风力发电量，英国电力价格两年来首次出现负增长。【原文：UK power prices turned negative for the first time in two years with Storm Amy set to deliver record wind generation through the weekend.】

item.title: 股票牛市欲罢不能，S&P涨势进入 "躁动 "区间
item.description: 股市涨势过猛的警钟敲得越响，投资者似乎就越听不进去。【原文：The louder the alarm bells are blaring about the stock-market rally getting excessive, the more investors appear to be tuning them out.】

item.title: 土耳其称在特朗普呼吁下俄罗斯石油采购量增至公司数量
item.description: 土耳其能源部长表示，购买俄罗斯石油是炼油厂做出的商业决定，这表明土耳其不愿遵守美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关于切断与莫斯科能源关系的呼吁。【原文：Turkey’s energy minister has said buying Russian oil is a commercial decision made by refiners, signaling reluctance to abide by US President Donald Trump’s calls to cut energy ties with Moscow.】

item.title: 牛肉供应紧张，全球肉类价格涨势扩大至创纪录水平
item.description: 全球肉类价格在 9 月份创下历史新高，这是自 2021 年以来持续时间最长的一次月度上涨。【原文：Global meat prices hit a fresh record high in September — in the longest run of monthly gains since 2021 — as shrinking US cattle herds are unable to keep up with strong demand for beef.】

item.title: 塔塔资本 17 亿美元首次公开募股吸引了 Counterpoint 和 White Oak
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，塔塔资本有限公司 17 亿美元的首次公开募股吸引了从摩根士丹利的 Counterpoint Global 到本地共同基金等众多投资者成为早期大投资者。【原文：Tata Capital Ltd.’s $1.7 billion initial public offering attracted investors ranging from Morgan Stanley’s Counterpoint Global to local mutual funds as early big investors, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 组织称西班牙发生数十年来最严重的停电事故
item.description: 一个地区电网组织表示，去年 4 月导致西班牙陷入黑暗的大停电是前所未有的事件，也是过去二十年来欧洲电网遭受的最严重的一次停电。【原文：The blackout that left Spain in the dark last April was an unprecedented event and the most severe to hit European networks in the last two decades, a regional power grids group said.】

item.title: 高盛集团所罗门预计美国经济和交易将加速增长
item.description: 大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）预计，美国经济将在2026年加速增长，因为持续的刺激政策和科技支出所带来的 "尾风 "将压倒疲软的劳动力市场和地缘政治动荡。【原文：David Solomon expects the US economy to accelerate into 2026 as tailwinds from continued stimulus and tech spending outweigh a softer labor market and geopolitical turmoil.】

item.title: 多伦多房价继续下滑，销售量却出现反弹
item.description: 随着加拿大央行恢复降息，上个月多伦多的房屋销售量有所上升，但由于挂牌房源过剩，买家的谈判能力增强，房价继续稳步下滑。【原文：Toronto home sales rose last month as the Bank of Canada resumed interest-rate cuts, though prices continued their steady decline as a glut of listings increased buyers’ negotiating power.】

item.title: 私人信贷基金为 JTC 私有化交易筹集 13 亿英镑资金
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士表示，私人信贷公司正在权衡提供价值约 13 亿英镑（18 亿美元）的一揽子债务，为 JTC Plc 潜在的私有化交易提供资金。【原文：Private credit firms are weighing up providing a debt package worth around £1.3 billion ($1.8 billion) to finance a potential take-private deal for JTC Plc, said people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国禁止必和必拓运输铁矿石，海岬型船运价受挫
item.description: 本周，由于必和必拓集团（BHP Group）向中国运输铁矿石的纠纷，干散货运价下跌了约 25%，这给本已遭遇季节性需求低迷的市场雪上加霜。【原文：Dry-bulk shipping rates have tumbled around 25% this week, with a dispute over BHP Group’s iron ore shipments to China adding strain to a market already suffering a seasonal lull in demand.】

item.title: 非洲石油生产商努力抓住新的投资浪潮
item.description: 在开普敦举行的 "非洲能源周 "上，石油生产商们的底气更足了。【原文：At African Energy Week in Cape Town, oil producers were emboldened.】

item.title: 华为在顶级人工智能芯片中使用台积电、三星和 SK 海力士的元件
item.description: 一家研究公司在拆解过程中发现，华为技术有限公司（Huawei Technologies Co.【原文：Huawei Technologies Co. used advanced components from Asia’s largest technology firms in at least some of its leading Ascend AI processors, a research firm discovered during teardowns, highlighting China’s reliance on foreign hardware as it works to boost domestic production of AI semiconductors.】

item.title: 与乔-阿贝特探讨美联储新目标和货币价格上涨的更多内容
item.description:
融资市场的情况正在发生变化。【原文：

Things are changing in funding markets.

】

item.title: 关于美联储目标和货币价格的更多内容（播客）
item.description: 我们习惯于谈论美联储改变 "基准利率"。但是，中央银行实际收紧或放松政策的机制要细微得多。多年来，美联储一直通过联邦基金市场（Federal Funds Market —）来实现这一目标，即美国银行借出和借入其超额准备金。但这种情况可能正在发生变化。上周，达拉斯联储主席洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）认为，联邦基金目标已经过时，央行应该寻找替代方案。那么【原文：We’re used to talking about the Federal Reserve changing “benchmark interest rates.” But the mechanics of how the central bank actually tightens or loosens policy are a lot more nuanced. For years now, the Fed’s been doing this through the federal funds market — where US banks lend and borrow their excess reserves. But that could be changing. Last week, Dallas Fed President Lorie Logan argued that the fed funds target is outdated, and the central bank should be looking at alternatives. So what w】

item.title: 美容科技集团伦敦首秀早盘股价上涨
item.description: Beauty Tech Group Ltd 的股票在伦敦证券交易所首次上市时的交易价格高于其发行价，这对该市今年迄今为止最大的首次公开募股来说是个好兆头。【原文：The Beauty Tech Group Ltd shares traded above their offer price on their London Stock Exchange debut, a positive omen for the city’s largest initial public offering so far this year.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织希望津巴布韦明确停止使用美元的计划
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）表示，津巴布韦必须更明确地说明其在 2030 年前逐步停止在国内使用美元的计划的影响，并指出当地货币 ZiG 尚未被广泛接受。【原文：The International Monetary Fund says Zimbabwe must provide more clarity on the implications on its plan to phase out domestic use of the US dollar by 2030, pointing out that the local currency, the ZiG, hasn’t yet found wide acceptance.】

item.title: 欧洲银行不断增加的风险承担将带来收入的增长
item.description: 欧洲银行对杠杆贷款的胃口越来越大，使收入前景更加光明，也为提高盈利预期打开了大门。【原文：European banks’ growing appetite for leveraged loans is brightening revenue prospects and opening the door to raised earnings estimates.】

item.title: 欧洲最垃圾的垃圾在残酷重组后被禁售
item.description: 欧洲最近一连串纷争不断的重组事件让债务投资者元气大伤，他们开始主动回避欧洲大陆风险最高的信贷。【原文：Debt investors have been so badly bruised by a recent string of fractious restructurings in Europe that they’ve started actively avoiding the continent’s riskiest credits.】

item.title: 2025 年，金股反超人工智能驱动的芯片涨势，涨幅达 135
item.description: 尽管今年人工智能和芯片类股票大受追捧，但黄金矿商实际上是更好的买点。【原文：For all the hype over artificial intelligence and the surge in chip stocks this year, gold miners have actually been the better buy.】

item.title: 受人工智能乐观情绪影响，欧洲股市将迎来五月份以来最好的一周
item.description: 在投资者对人工智能发展持乐观态度的推动下，欧洲股市有望创下 5 月份以来最强劲的一周，连续第六天上涨。【原文：European stocks were on track for their strongest week since May, gaining for a sixth day in a row, driven by investor optimism over artificial intelligence developments.】

item.title: 日本央行的不确定性导致日本利率波动性升至欧洲之上
item.description: 由于日本央行货币政策前景的不确定性不断增加，日元利率的波动性七年来首次超过欧元利率。【原文：Volatility for yen interest rates has climbed above that of euro ones for the first time in seven years amid growing uncertainty over the outlook for Bank of Japan monetary policy.】

item.title: 法国 8 月工业生产意外下降
item.description: 由于企业和家庭面临着政治和财政不确定性的加剧，法国 8 月份的工业生产意外下降，使欧元区第二大经济体的低迷迹象更加明显。【原文：France’s industrial production unexpectedly dropped in August, adding to signals of sluggishness in the euro area’s second-largest economy as businesses and households face heightened political and fiscal uncertainty.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀意外可能改变降息步伐
item.description: 土耳其的通胀率一年多来首次加速上升，这让人怀疑土耳其央行能否继续推进最近一连串的大幅降息措施。【原文：Turkish inflation accelerated for the first time in more than a year, casting doubt on whether the central bank can push ahead with its recent string of sizable interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 金枪鱼罐头公司 Princes 宣布伦敦首次公开募股计划
item.description: 包装食品公司王子集团（Princes Group Plc）表示，它正计划在伦敦证券交易所进行首次公开募股，这标志着英国市场的一个可喜进展。【原文：Packaged food company Princes Group Plc said it’s planning an initial public offering on the London Stock Exchange, marking a welcome boost for the UK market.】

item.title: 印尼因数据共享纠纷吊销 TikTok 许可证
item.description: 印尼暂停了 TikTok 在当地的运营许可，因为该公司在 8 月份的全国抗议活动中拒绝完全分享其直播流媒体活动的数据。【原文：Indonesia suspended TikTok’s local operating license after the company refused to fully share data on its live streaming activity during nationwide protests in August.】

item.title: 贸易战分流液化石油气，印度寻求首批美国液化石油气货物
item.description: 由于华盛顿的贸易战扰乱了烹饪燃料和塑料前体的流通，印度正在寻求从美国获得第一批长期液化石油气供应。【原文：India is seeking to secure its first long-term supplies of liquefied petroleum gas from the US, as Washington’s trade war disrupts flows of the cooking fuel and plastics precursor.】
